curam.util.common.plugin

Interface PlugIn

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ComponentRenderer<C>, DomainComparator, DomainConverter, DomainDefault, DomainMarshal, DomainOptions, DomainPlugIn, DomainRenderer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClientDomainPlugIn, AbstractComparator, AbstractComponentRenderer, AbstractConverter, AbstractDefault, AbstractDomainMarshal, AbstractDomainPlugIn, AbstractDomainRenderer, AbstractEditRenderer, AbstractPlugIn, AbstractSelectRenderer, AbstractViewRenderer, BirthdateConverter, BirthdateMarshal, ClientDomainOptions, CodeTableCodeCaseInsensitiveComparator, CodeTableCodeComparator, CodeTableCodeConverter, CodeTableCodeDefault, CodeTableCodeLocaleAwareComparator, CuramTimeComparator, CuramTimeConverter, CurrencySymbol, DateTimeConverter, curam.util.common.domain.DefaultMutableDomainOptions, DynamicTypeConverter, FrequencyPatternConverter, InternalIDConverter, LocalizedMessageConverter, SimpleXPathADCMarshal, SimpleXPathMarshal, SvrBlobComparator, SvrBlobConverter, SvrBlobDefault, SvrBooleanComparator, SvrBooleanConverter, SvrBooleanDefault, SvrCharComparator, SvrCharConverter, SvrCharDefault, SvrDateComparator, SvrDateConverter, SvrDateDefault, SvrDateTimeComparator, SvrDateTimeConverter, SvrDateTimeDefault, SvrDateTimeDefaultCurrTime, SvrDoubleComparator, SvrDoubleConverter, SvrDoubleDefault, SvrDoubleOneDecimalPlaceConvertor, SvrFloatComparator, SvrFloatConverter, SvrFloatDefault, SvrInt16BareConverter, SvrInt16Comparator, SvrInt16Converter, SvrInt16Default, SvrInt32BareConverter, SvrInt32Comparator, SvrInt32Converter, SvrInt32Default, SvrInt64BareConverter, SvrInt64Comparator, SvrInt64Converter, SvrInt64Default, SvrInt8BareConverter, SvrInt8Comparator, SvrInt8Converter, SvrInt8Default, SvrMoneyComparator, SvrMoneyConverter, SvrMoneyDefault, SvrStringCaseInsensitiveComparator, SvrStringComparator, SvrStringConverter, SvrStringDefault, SvrStringLocaleAwareComparator

    public interface PlugIn
    A simple interface for all plug-ins. Instances of the implementations of plug-ins return a name that must match the plug-in name used in the respective configuration file. Instances may also access the active locale and time zone and the configuration properties. All of the methods of this interface, with the exception of PlugIn.getName(), are implemented in the infrastructure's AbstractPlugIn class; that class, or one of its derivatives, should be used as the basis of any custom plug-in implementations. However, specific types of plug-ins may further require the use of a more specific base class.

      Gets the container to which this plug-in was added (or the container to which the owner of this plug-in was added, if it was added indirectly).

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the plug-in. This is usually the simple name used to identify the plug-in when loaded. Many different plug-in classes may share the same name if they implement the same type of behavior. For example, "converter" may be used as the name of a plug-in that performs data conversion operations, but there may be different "converter" classes implementing these operations.
        Returns:
        The name of the plug-in. This must not be null.

      • getLocale

        java.util.Locale getLocale()
        Gets the locale associated with this plug-in instance. The locale is typically derived from the active locale of the user who made the request that triggered the processing that required this plug-in.
        Returns:
        The locale. May be null.

      • getTimeZone

        java.util.TimeZone getTimeZone()
        Gets the time zone associated with this plug-in instance. The time zone is typically derived from the active time zone of the user who made the request that triggered the processing that required this plug-in.
        Returns:
        The time zone. May be null.

      • getOwner

        PlugIn getOwner()
        Gets the plug-in that owns this plug-in (if any). Plug-ins that re-use other plug-ins "own" those re-used plug-in instances. If a plug-in is not being re-used by another, then its owner will be null.
        Returns:
        The owner of this plug-in.

      • getContainer

        PlugInContainer<?> getContainer()
        Gets the container to which this plug-in was added (or the container to which the owner of this plug-in was added, if it was added indirectly).
        Returns:
        The container of this plug-in.

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a named configuration property of this plug-in. The properties are set in the plug-in configuration file. If the property does not exist, null will be returned. The interpretation of the property value is left to the plug-in implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the configuration property.
        Returns:
        The property value, or null if it is not set.

      • getLocalPlugIn

        PlugIn getLocalPlugIn(java.lang.String localPurpose)
               throws PlugInException
        Gets a plug-in configured for the specified local purpose. The plug-in configuration can associate plug-ins configured for a specific purpose (for example, "text-input") to be re-used for the local purpose of this plug-in (for example, re-use the plug-in configured for "text-input" for the local purpose of "month-input"). Given the local purpose, the original purpose can be determined and this can be resolved to a specific instance of a plug-in. Plug-in implementations may chose to throw an exception if the local plug-in is not configured. However, they may choose not to throw an exception if the use of the local plug-in is optional or is one of a number of alternative local plug-ins.
        Parameters:
        localPurpose - The local purpose defined in the configuration.
        Returns:
        The plug-in configured for the given local purpose.
        Throws:
        PlugInException - If the local purpose has not been configured.

      • acceptData

        boolean acceptData(java.lang.Object data)
            throws PlugInException
        Indicates if the plug-in will accept the given data for processing. It is up to the plug-in to decide what data it will accept. This method is called by the system before any processing methods of the specific types of supported plug-ins are called. Those processing methods will not be called if the data is not accepted, so this method allows the other methods on this plug-in to be written with the minimum of safety checks.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be processed; may be null.
        Returns:
        true if the plug-in will accept the data for processing, false otherwise. If false, an error will be reported by the system.
        Throws:
        PlugInException - If the reason for the rejection of the data is complex and a more specific exception message would make it easier to determine how to remedy the problem, an exception may be thrown instead of returning false.

      • acceptConfiguration

        boolean acceptConfiguration()
                     throws PlugInException
        Indicates if the plug-in will accept its configuration. It is up to the plug-in to decide what configuration it will accept. The configuration is accessible via the other methods on this interface. This method is called by the system only once when the plug-in is loaded and configured. The system will not start until all of the plug-ins accept their configurations, so this method allows the other methods on this plug-in to be written with the minimum of safety checks.
        Returns:
        true if the plug-in will accept its configuration, false otherwise. If false, an error will be reported by the system.
        Throws:
        PlugInException - If the reason for the rejection of the configuration is complex and a more specific exception message would make it easier to determine how to remedy the problem, an exception may be thrown instead of returning false.
